channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kodiak taps Bosch to scale its self-driving truck tech
item.description: There is no timeline for when these systems will become available. But once they do, Kodiak could bring its tech to more trucks, faster.

item.title: Amazon’s AI assistant comes to the web with Alexa.com
item.description: Amazon is bringing Alexa+ to the web with a new Alexa.com site, expanding its AI assistant beyond devices and positioning it as a family-focused, agen...

item.title: CES Live Blog, Day 1: The Coolest Tech We’ve Seen So Far
item.description: Read our live updates from CES 2026 in Las Vegas to see the latest consumer gadgetry in all of its chatbot-enabled, sensor-packed, AI-infused glory.

item.title: Google previews new Gemini features for TV at CES 2026
item.description: Google TV will let you ask Gemini to find and edit your photos, adjust your TV settings and more.

item.title: Amazon revamps Fire TV, launches its own ‘Artline’ televisions with frames at CES
item.description: Fire TV's new interface focuses on your content and offers easier, speedier navigation, Amazon says.

item.title: I Switched to eSIM, and I Am Full of Regret
item.description: Switching between mobile phones used to be easy. Then came eSIM.

item.title: Flu Is Relentless. Crispr Might Be Able to Shut It Down
item.description: Innovative research into the gene-editing tool targets influenza’s ability to replicate—stopping it in its tracks.

item.title: At CES 2026, Everything Is AI. What Matters Is How You Use It
item.description: Integrated chatbots and built-in machine intelligence are no longer standout features in consumer tech. If companies want to win in the AI era, they’v...

item.title: Luminar claims founder Austin Russell is dodging a subpoena in the bankruptcy case
item.description: The Luminar founder claims he has been cooperative.

item.title: LG’s new OLED TV is just 9mm thick
item.description: This year LG is showing off its manufacturing chops at CES with a new Wallpaper OLED TV that is just 9mm thick.
